N case, the LUMO increases as an
increase of the Ga content because an energy level of Ga
is higher than that of In
, resulting in an increase of the
band-gap. In the present case, Fe 3
forms the bottom of the LUMO, significantly below the unoccupied
the other cations, as shown in Supplementary Fig. S7. Therefore, partial substitutions of trivalent cations, which
can shift up the location of the LUMO from the Fe 3
levels, for Fe may be effective to increase the band-gap.

can be obtained by the differences in energies between supercells with and without antisites. The positions of
the antisites were obtained by exchanging nearest-neighboring sites under the stoichiometric condition. The
